data.text: Is There a Way to Insulate the Water Bottle?

Looking for water bottle insulation recommendations - ideally something like a neoprene sleeve I can slip over a 1.5L smart water. It's being mounted in an anything cage. Hydro flasks are nice and all but overall very heavy and expensive. I'm also down to make my own but would rather phone it in and just throw $10 at the problem.
Would a Nalgene insulating sleeve work? Pretty close in size

data.text: I use a Topeak Modula XL cage (says it's adjustable for 1-1.5L bottles like this - though I haven't found any 1L bottles tall enough to fit in it, so I just use 1.5L bottles. All the 1.5L bottles I can find in stores seem to be "alkaline water", which is gross - where did you find 1.5L smartwater?). I don't think they've been made in a while, but you can still find them cheap - bike shops clearing out old stock, I imagine? The problem with them being old is that the rubber strap at the top is probably decaying. So I got some SKS rubber straps (the kind used to hold on detachable fenders), and those fit fine - just fold over one end and put a pin / rivet / snap whatever through it so it doesn't pull through.
